intro: Artemisia arbuscula subsp. thermopola, commonly known as the desert sagebrush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in dry soils. It plays a vital role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species. Its essential oils have been used in traditional medicine for their antimicrobial and antifungal properties.
